content:
500.png
Hi! I'm interested in redesigning some of the landing & error pages. I quite liked the underwater theme that was suggested in one of the old git issues. This is a quick sketch-- feedback would be appreciated! :)
That looks amazing!
cheers! i think it's a bit too simple-- would maybe like to add a bit more background sea-things and make the octopus larger!
Idk, I personally prefer a minimal style
Yes its really great ! Having custom 404 & 500 error page will be awesome !
even rougher, but i just wanted to get the idea out on paper. err...screen?404.png
How does it look in a widescreen display (16:9)?
widedisp.png not sure whether the background needs a few more fishes to make it less plain
Looks fine to me
In fact, I would suggest adding a gradient to the background, so it fades to white on the side (or the other way)
that is a wonderful idea!
You can centralise the card a bit more and add some more fishes , Overall it will look like server has drowned in the sea
what do you mean by centralise? (i think i aligned it to the center!)
hehehe yeah :D
I meant a little more centralised vertically ,margin from bottom looks too less now
There wouldn't be much text in the box anyway, try to take those out
@Tommy Ip true that
This looks awesome! I really like this direction for the 500 page.

For the 404 page, I think it'd be cool to have a lot of variety in the fishes that we show there.

As a sidenote, the 20000 puzzles under the sea MIT Mystery Hunt has a bunch of cool fish graphics http://20000puzzles.com/accounts/login/?next=/ has a ton of awesome mutant fish designs and could be a good source for inspiration. I'll try to see if I can find a link that shows them all.
http://web.mit.edu/puzzle/www/2015/intro.html is the link to the full site

Some ideas on things that could be tweaked in the 500 page; feel free to ignore them all though @Vaida Plankyte:

  • The octopus currently has only 4 visible arms; it might make sense to show more arms
  • Since this is a 500 page, the could be broken into two pieces. If we do that, one cute variation concept would be for the octopus to be repairing it rather than having broken it.
@Tim Abbott really like the idea of the octopus repairing it! :) i've implemented some of your and @Brock Whittaker 's feedback. This is the second version! 500v2.png
wow, that site has a lot of cartooney fish references, cheers!
aaand an ameliorated 404 page. :) 404v2.png

Cool! I definitely like the extra legs.

For the 500 page, I'm not sure I like the geometric shape parts on the ground as the model; I had been thinking more of a Z that looks more torn than having chunks fallen out; that might also be a little simpler to draw since you only need one tear point that looks good rather than 5.

I like the more varied 404 page :).
Got feedback from a friend, she didn't catch it was a Z, so definitely worth making a smaller tear/crack.
I was struggling with communicating the break while also keeping the general logo intact-- having tears along the original version is a very good alternative!
